<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/15/cop25-climate-talks-go-extras-no-one-wins?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Climate Talks Go to Extras, No One Wins
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="coal fired power plant " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NDM4OTg0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sean Gallup/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The longest UN climate discussions in history concluded Sunday. But more doesn’t always mean “holy cow we’re making such great progress.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It was just the opposite.</strong> Delegates from nearly 200 countries left the COP25 in Madrid <a href="https://apnews.com/aca79ab4956f370b8892ba574fe56834?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">openly frustrated</a> about the lack of consensus on how to meet the targets set by the 2015 Paris Climate Agreement. This, from UN Secretary-General António Guterres, is as close to a rage tweet as you can find in global diplomacy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1576438496.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://twitter.com/antonioguterres?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>@antonioguterres</em></a></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“This COP did not deliver all we came here for,” <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/33f5d282-1f3f-11ea-92da-f0c92e957a96?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">admitted the EU</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What they came there for</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Countries were hoping to hammer out an agreement on carbon trading. Carbon trading essentially turns CO2 into a commodity in which emissions credits can be bought and sold by polluters.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Emissions permits can either be doled out to companies or bought at an auction. These tradeable permits effectively give companies the “</span><span><a href="https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2017/09/everything-you-need-to-know-about-carbon-trading/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">right to pollute</a></span><span>.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The idea is to reduce emissions by limiting the number of available permits over time, forcing polluters to invest in cleaner technologies. Advocates say carbon trading could save $320 billion in efficiency gains, </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-15/carbon-markets-fail-to-win-backing-at-un-climate-talks?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Bloomberg</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If that sounds complicated laid out in the Brew, think how difficult it is to implement across the globe, especially given the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/15/climate/cop25-un-climate-talks-madrid.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tensions</a> between developed nations (which have contributed to climate change for decades) and develop<em>ing</em> nations (which have only recently industrialized and must bear the consequences).  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s why some environmental activists are glad a carbon trading deal hasn’t worked out. Many don’t believe financial markets can encourage the sorts of emissions reductions required to, well, save the world. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What is required: </strong>Countries are working to <a href="https://www.axios.com/un-climate-change-talks-no-deal-21dac98d-d9d5-4cde-a098-b9391a72d578.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">limit temperature increases</a> to 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, ideally 1.5 degrees.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the summit is headed to Glasgow, Scotland, next year. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
OBIT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/15/felix-rohatyn-man-saved-new-york-city-dies-91?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Man Who Saved New York City Dies
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="GW bridge in NYC" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NDI2MTc0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Felix Rohatyn, a European refugee turned Wall Street legend, died at 91 on Saturday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Rohatyn pioneered the M&A advisory business in the 1960s. Working with companies like GE, Revlon, and AT&T, he earned the nickname “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-14/felix-rohatyn-banker-who-helped-rescue-new-york-dies-at-91?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Felix the Fixer</a>” for brokering some of the deals that created today’s corporate landscape.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/14/nyregion/felix-rohatyn-dead.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">His take</a></span><span> on the industry: “Investment banking is not a business; it is a personal service where bankers work hand in hand with their clients.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With deep thoughts like that, Rohatyn <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/felix-rohatyn-dies-at-91-11576368743?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">was tapped</a> to help NYC stave off bankruptcy in 1975, when lenders cut off the city from additional short-term credit. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>You might not realize it from walking around Manhattan today, but 1970s-era New York was in a deep financial manhole. It had an annual deficit of $1.5 billion a year on a budget of roughly $12 billion. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But Rohatyn engineered an emergency plan that was painful but effective. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In his later years, Rohatyn <a href="https://apnews.com/e0c7b6487b452aa2772a2db156ea5b8c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">became</a> the U.S. ambassador to France, an author, and a finance sage.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

</a><span>  </span>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ADVERTISING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/15/hallmark-criticized-pulling-ads-featuring-lesbian-kiss?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Makes Hallmark Family Friendly?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Zola commercial " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjA2L3pvbGFfY29tbWVyY2lhbC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Zola</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">TFW you try to do something to avoid controversy then end up being the subject of a boycott during your busiest season.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last Thursday, the Hallmark Channel pulled four TV ads from the wedding planning website Zola that featured two brides kissing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A spokesperson for Hallmark <a href="https://apnews.com/7926c82c3a646ebe73c13d98d1c43bd7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confirmed to the AP</a> that the conservative group One Million Moms complained about the spots to Bill Abbott, the CEO of Hallmark parent Crown Media Family Networks. “The Hallmark brand is never going to be divisive. We don’t want to generate controversy,” the spokesperson said at the time.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But pulling the ads in which a lesbian couple kissed while <em>not </em>rejecting the spots featuring a heterosexual couple did just that. Prominent figures from Ellen Degeneres to <a href="https://twitter.com/PeteButtigieg/status/1206298996408492036?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">presidential candidates</a> criticized Hallmark. And Zola said it would <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/stephaniemcneal/hallmark-pulled-an-ad-because-it-featured-a-same-sex-couple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stop advertising</a> with Hallmark entirely. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facing calls for a boycott, Hallmark said late last night it <a href="https://corporate.hallmark.com/news-article/hallmark-affirms-its-commitment-to-diversity-and-inclusion/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made a mistake</a> in pulling the ads. The channel also pledged to reach out to Zola to <span>reinstate the commercials. "We are truly sorry for the hurt and disappointment this has caused,” said Mike Perry, the president and CEO of Hallmark. </span></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">

SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/15/chinese-tv-pulls-arsenal-game-ozil-comments?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
China Puts Nationalism Over Sports...Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Mesut Ozil " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NDIyODkzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Clive Rose/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In most parts of the world, football Sunday yesterday meant watching Arsenal lose to Manchester City in a big English Premier League clash. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But not in China. The Chinese state broadcaster CCTV <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-14/arsenal-takes-nba-approach-by-distancing-from-player-s-china-jab?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pulled the game</a> because of comments made on social media by Arsenal midfielder Mesut <span>Özil </span>over the Chinese government’s internment of Uighur Muslims. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The comments </span><span><a href="https://www.espn.com/soccer/arsenal/story/4013387/ozil-row-sees-arsenal-manchester-city-pulled-from-china-state-tv?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upset</a></span><span> many soccer fans in China, where </span><span><span>Özil </span></span><span>is a BFD. His fan community of over 100,000 said it was shutting down as a result: “As Chinese people we cannot accept this,” a statement read. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Arsenal went into clean-up mode. It posted on Chinese social media that <span>Özil </span>did not speak for the club and that “Arsenal always adheres to the principle of not being involved in politics”...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...especially in China, where the club opened a <a href="https://www.arsenal.com/news/arsenal-sports-bar-restaurant-launched-china?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sports bar and restaurant</a> in 2018. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Having déjà Brew?</strong> In October, Houston Rockets GM Daryl Morey sparked an international firestorm when he tweeted support for pro-democracy protestors in Hong Kong, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/07/houston-rockets-draw-ire-gms-china-stance?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">drawing retaliation</a> against the NBA from the Chinese government.</p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe longest UN climate discussions in history concluded Sunday. But more doesn’t always mean “holy cow we’re making such great progress.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt was just the opposite.\u003c/strong\u003e Delegates from nearly 200 countries left the COP25 in Madrid \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/aca79ab4956f370b8892ba574fe56834?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopenly frustrated\u003c/a\u003e about the lack of consensus on how to meet the targets set by the 2015 Paris Climate Agreement. This, from UN Secretary-General António Guterres, is as close to a rage tweet as you can find in global diplomacy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1576438496.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/antonioguterres?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e@antonioguterres\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“This COP did not deliver all we came here for,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/33f5d282-1f3f-11ea-92da-f0c92e957a96?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadmitted the EU\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat they came there for\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCountries were hoping to hammer out an agreement on carbon trading. Carbon trading essentially turns CO2 into a commodity in which emissions credits can be bought and sold by polluters.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eEmissions permits can either be doled out to companies or bought at an auction. These tradeable permits effectively give companies the “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2017/09/everything-you-need-to-know-about-carbon-trading/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eright to pollute\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe idea is to reduce emissions by limiting the number of available permits over time, forcing polluters to invest in cleaner technologies. Advocates say carbon trading could save $320 billion in efficiency gains, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-15/carbon-markets-fail-to-win-backing-at-un-climate-talks?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf that sounds complicated laid out in the Brew, think how difficult it is to implement across the globe, especially given the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/15/climate/cop25-un-climate-talks-madrid.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etensions\u003c/a\u003e between developed nations (which have contributed to climate change for decades) and develop\u003cem\u003eing\u003c/em\u003e nations (which have only recently industrialized and must bear the consequences).  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s why some environmental activists are glad a carbon trading deal hasn’t worked out. Many don’t believe financial markets can encourage the sorts of emissions reductions required to, well, save the world. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat is required: \u003c/strong\u003eCountries are working to \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/un-climate-change-talks-no-deal-21dac98d-d9d5-4cde-a098-b9391a72d578.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elimit temperature increases\u003c/a\u003e to 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, ideally 1.5 degrees.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe summit is headed to Glasgow, Scotland, next year. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFelix Rohatyn, a European refugee turned Wall Street legend, died at 91 on Saturday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRohatyn pioneered the M\u0026A advisory business in the 1960s. Working with companies like GE, Revlon, and AT\u0026T, he earned the nickname “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-14/felix-rohatyn-banker-who-helped-rescue-new-york-dies-at-91?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFelix the Fixer\u003c/a\u003e” for brokering some of the deals that created today’s corporate landscape.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/14/nyregion/felix-rohatyn-dead.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eHis take\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on the industry: “Investment banking is not a business; it is a personal service where bankers work hand in hand with their clients.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith deep thoughts like that, Rohatyn \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/felix-rohatyn-dies-at-91-11576368743?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewas tapped\u003c/a\u003e to help NYC stave off bankruptcy in 1975, when lenders cut off the city from additional short-term credit. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYou might not realize it from walking around Manhattan today, but 1970s-era New York was in a deep financial manhole. It had an annual deficit of $1.5 billion a year on a budget of roughly $12 billion. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut Rohatyn engineered an emergency plan that was painful but effective. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn his later years, Rohatyn \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/e0c7b6487b452aa2772a2db156ea5b8c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebecame\u003c/a\u003e the U.S. ambassador to France, an author, and a finance sage.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eZola\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTFW you try to do something to avoid controversy then end up being the subject of a boycott during your busiest season.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast Thursday, the Hallmark Channel pulled four TV ads from the wedding planning website Zola that featured two brides kissing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA spokesperson for Hallmark \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/7926c82c3a646ebe73c13d98d1c43bd7?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econfirmed to the AP\u003c/a\u003e that the conservative group One Million Moms complained about the spots to Bill Abbott, the CEO of Hallmark parent Crown Media Family Networks. “The Hallmark brand is never going to be divisive. We don’t want to generate controversy,” the spokesperson said at the time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut pulling the ads in which a lesbian couple kissed while \u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003erejecting the spots featuring a heterosexual couple did just that. Prominent figures from Ellen Degeneres to \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/PeteButtigieg/status/1206298996408492036?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epresidential candidates\u003c/a\u003e criticized Hallmark. And Zola said it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/stephaniemcneal/hallmark-pulled-an-ad-because-it-featured-a-same-sex-couple?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estop advertising\u003c/a\u003e with Hallmark entirely. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacing calls for a boycott, Hallmark said late last night it \u003ca href=\"https://corporate.hallmark.com/news-article/hallmark-affirms-its-commitment-to-diversity-and-inclusion/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade a mistake\u003c/a\u003e in pulling the ads. The channel also pledged to reach out to Zola to \u003cspan\u003ereinstate the commercials. \"We are truly sorry for the hurt and disappointment this has caused,” said Mike Perry, the president and CEO of Hallmark. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn most parts of the world, football Sunday yesterday meant watching Arsenal lose to Manchester City in a big English Premier League clash. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut not in China. The Chinese state broadcaster CCTV \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-14/arsenal-takes-nba-approach-by-distancing-from-player-s-china-jab?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epulled the game\u003c/a\u003e because of comments made on social media by Arsenal midfielder Mesut \u003cspan\u003eÖzil \u003c/span\u003eover the Chinese government’s internment of Uighur Muslims. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe comments \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/soccer/arsenal/story/4013387/ozil-row-sees-arsenal-manchester-city-pulled-from-china-state-tv?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eupset\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e many soccer fans in China, where \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eÖzil \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eis a BFD. His fan community of over 100,000 said it was shutting down as a result: “As Chinese people we cannot accept this,” a statement read. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eArsenal went into clean-up mode. It posted on Chinese social media that \u003cspan\u003eÖzil \u003c/span\u003edid not speak for the club and that “Arsenal always adheres to the principle of not being involved in politics”...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...especially in China, where the club opened a \u003ca href=\"https://www.arsenal.com/news/arsenal-sports-bar-restaurant-launched-china?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esports bar and restaurant\u003c/a\u003e in 2018. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHaving déjà Brew?\u003c/strong\u003e In October, Houston Rockets GM Daryl Morey sparked an international firestorm when he tweeted support for pro-democracy protestors in Hong Kong, \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/07/houston-rockets-draw-ire-gms-china-stance?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edrawing retaliation\u003c/a\u003e against the NBA from the Chinese government.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
